poem:
Title: In the Veil of Verity

In hallowed halls, where Honour once had stood,
Stalks now a phantom, born of falsehood's brood. 
Deceptive lips that spout unblemished lies,
Echo through chambers, swirling in disguise. 
Alas, the gavel of truth, so hard and cold,
Crashes most heavily upon the bold.
Yet, tears for Claudine lest we forget,
For any fall from grace begets regret.

But it was allegations of plagiarism that ultimately led to her resignation on Wednesday. Investigations by the Washington Free Beacon and the New York Post, at least". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
